intro: Rubus jactus, commonly known as the common blackberry shrub, is a species of brambles belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces aggregate fruits, commonly referred to as blackberries, which are rich in antioxidants and have a tart flavor. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Rubus jactus plays an important role in supporting local wildlife by providing food and habitat.
